glb module

glb module gives global variables such as a instance of main window.

Functions used by general users are given in functions module.

All global variables can NOT be directly imported from lys because these are used only by developers.

Developers should import lys.glb module to access global variables

Example

>>> from lys import glb
>>> shell = glb.shell()
>>> main = glb.mainWindow()
lys.glb.createMainWindow(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Create main window.

This function is called by lys automatically, and thus users and developers need not to use this function.

If you want to make custom launch script of lys, see __main__ module.

lys.glb.mainWindow()[source]

Return MainWindow.MainWindow object.

MainWindow is used to realize new GUI functionalities in lys. See MainWindow.MainWindow for detailed description.

lys.glb.restoreWorkspaces()[source]

Restore workspaces.

This function is called by lys automatically, and thus users and developers need not to use this function.

If you want to make custom launch script of lys, see __main__ module.

lys.glb.shell()[source]

Return shell.ExtendShell object.

ExtendShell object is used to realize new functionalities in lys Python Interface. See shell.ExtendShell for detailed description.
